text: Saxo-fridericia is a group of plants in the family Rapateaceae described as a genus in 1845.Schomburgk, Robert Hermann. 1845. Die Rapatea Friderici Angusti 13Tropicos, Saxo-fridericia R.H. Schomb The genus is endemic to northern South America.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant Families ; Species * Saxo- fridericia aculeata Körn \- N Brazil (Amapá, Amazonas), SE Colombia, Guyana, French Guiana, Suriname * Saxo-fridericia compressa Maguire \- Venezuela (Amazonas), Brazil (Amazonas) * Saxo-fridericia duidae Maguire \- Venezuela (Amazonas) * Saxo-fridericia grandis Maguire \- Venezuela (Amazonas) * Saxo- fridericia inermis Ducke \- Brazil (Amazonas), Venezuela (Amazonas), Colombia (Guainía) * Saxo-fridericia petiolata Maguire \- Venezuela (Amazonas) * Saxo- fridericia regalis R.H.Schomb. \- Roraima, Venezuela (Bolívar, Amazonas), Guyana * Saxo-fridericia spongiosa Maguire \- Venezuela (Amazonas), Brazil (Amazonas) ==References== Category:Poales genera Category:Rapateaceae Category:Flora of South America
title: Saxo-fridericia
